definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Both areas have front access with pivoting doors, and are accessed via glass doors.
sentences.chinese: 兩個區域都有帶旋轉門的正面通道，通過玻璃門出入。

sentences.english: Perhaps in a revolving door ever being face to face.
sentences.chinese: 在旋轉門面對面的那一剎。

sentences.english: The revolving door between Washington and Wall Street needs to be jammed.
sentences.chinese: 華盛頓與華爾街之間的旋轉門亦需被堵住。

sentences.english: George went back through the swinging door into the kitchen and untied Nick and the cook.
sentences.chinese: 喬治從轉門走進廚房，把尼克跟廚子兩個人鬆開了綁。

sentences.english: I'd like to ask them whether they remember, perhaps in a revolving door ever being face to face.
sentences.chinese: 我想問他們是否記得，在旋轉門面對面的那一剎。

sentences.english: A swinging door hit me and I really saw stars.
sentences.chinese: 一扇旋轉門撞得我兩眼冒金星。

sentences.english: That's the so-called revolving door issue.
sentences.chinese: 這就是所謂的旋轉門的問題。

sentences.english: Passing through the turnstile is another line that marks a transition back to the locked node.
sentences.chinese: 通過旋轉門則是另一線條，代表轉變回上鎖節點。

sentences.english: A:We put tokens in this slot and push the turn_stile,right?
sentences.chinese: 我們將代幣投入這個孔，然後推這個十字轉門，對嗎？

sentences.english: I want to ask them if they don't remember…a moment face to face in some revolving door?
sentences.chinese: 我想問他們是否記得，在旋轉門面對面那一剎。

sentences.english: Chuck Norris can slam a revolving door.
sentences.chinese: 羅禮士能夠關上一扇旋轉門。

definition: to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to cut ties/to disconnect/out of touch
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
